text: Would it in principle be possible to run Julia on iOS? It used to be impossible to do this some years ago because of Apple, but there probably were some changes to this? Or?

text: <@UDSU53PEG> no there were some actual changes to ios 14.2 a while ago that allows for JIT compilation, OP probably read that somewhere

text: but still it's not really official and you can't submit apps to the appstore with jit compilation. Your best bet would be AoT compiling julia but that's a tricky one and it's not currently possible.

elements.text: but still it's not really official and you can't submit apps to the appstore with jit compilation. Your best bet would be AoT compiling julia but that's a tricky one and it's not currently possible.

text: It's not even possible to AoT compile all of julia so you'd still have to bring in the JIT compiler with the app.

elements.text: It's not even possible to AoT compile all of julia so you'd still have to bring in the JIT compiler with the app.

text: What should be possible though is making a library of the essential julia parts, compiling it AoT and then calling it from whatever language you make the majority of the app in, like swift. But PROPER AoT compiling is still not really possible IMO.

elements.text: What should be possible though is making a library of the essential julia parts, compiling it AoT and then calling it from whatever language you make the majority of the app in, like swift. But PROPER AoT compiling is still not really possible IMO.

text: JIT can mean different things and not all JIT is like Julias, though I jested since ultimately it's become an open question of which platform is now the worst for developers to support still MS (a real PITA btw), or now Apple?

attachments.title: iOS 14.2 brings JIT compilation support, which enables emulation apps at full performance - 9to5Mac
attachments.text: You may know some unofficial iOS apps that offer some kind of emulation. These apps run based on hacks and exploits, which reduces performance considerably — but that’s about to change. Apple has silently introduced support for Just-In-Time (JIT) compilation on iOS 14.2, which will allow emulation apps to run at full speed on the […]
